snippet: Tens of thousands of children in Senegal are being exploited by Quranic teachers who force them to beg in the streets, Human Rights Watch said Monday.
abstract: Human Rights Watch reports that tens of thousands of Senegalese children are being forced by Quranic schools to beg in streets; blames government for failure to carry out 2005 law against trafficking and exploitation of children.
lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of children in Senegal are being exploited by Quranic teachers who force them to beg in the streets, Human Rights Watch said Monday.

headline.main: Senegal: Students Are Forced to Beg
headline.print_headline: Africa; Senegal: Thousands of Islamic Students Are Forced to Beg, Rights Group Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
